embeds.title: Manifest
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 2 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 16 (20) **Block** :p_block:.
Add a Decay to your hand.

messages.content: I like this card

its "kind of" a draw neutral, so it works great with Covet, also pretty good with Final Canter and Magnum because it doesn't lower hand size. Good with Spite and <exhaust card if curse all enemies> on 4 energy
solid strong block card with curse synergy

embeds.title: Malice
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

**Exhaust** a card.
Deal 16 (20) damage.
If you **Exhaust** a **Curse**, deal 16 (20) damage to ALL enemies instead.

footer.text: <exhaust card if curse all enemies> = malice, 72% sure

messages.content: big block + small curse
what more could you want
pretty damn good
It's like scuffed AOE Roughhouse on 4 energy
not much to go on regarding common cards
my favorite part about this card is that the curse is added directly into the hand instead of Inserted, so there is a lot of combo potential later in the run

I'd kinda disagree with it being good with spite and malice. Especially spite, you play 2 energy for the block and then a 3rd for spite to draw. How much energy do you then have? 1 energy if you had an energy relic, if not, nothing
Hermit is famous for generating energy in unconventional ways so that's not necessary true
<cheat> loses value in a curse deck, <lone wolf> is alright i guess but i rarely took it much, <eye of the storm> and <overwhelming power> are single-use

embeds.title: Cheat
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Play one of the top 3 (5) cards in your draw pile.
**Dead On:** Also trigger its **Dead On** effect.

embeds.title: Lone Wolf
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Choose a card.
It costs 0 this turn.
Discard the rest of your hand.

embeds.title: Eye Of The Storm
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain :e_hermit: up to your maximum.
**Exhaust**.

embeds.title: Overwhelming Power
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain :e_hermit: :e_hermit: :e_hermit:.
Draw 3 (4) cards.
Whenever you end your turn with 0 :e_hermit:, lose 4 (3) HP.

messages.content: even in non-curse decks I will grab a manifest
because it's a good strong block card
idk i feel like the antisynergy when not curse deck makes it meh

this card is kinda awful. the decay makes this effectively 14 block for 2 energy, thats really bad value compared to other cards like protect, leg sweep and flame barrier, You basically have to have curse synergy to take this and even when you do its still not even that great compared to a card like fatal desire or misfire which provide a much greater benefit for your energy outside of generating a curse
protect is 12
flame barrier is also 12 and uncommon
leg sweep is 11 in raw block
the weaken more than makes up for that
and that's why I said "raw block"
of course the weak will be quite a bit more damage mitigation
well yes but what was the point you were making?
Would be better if adapt activated at the end of turn instead of beginning
I don't like it being at the beginning tbh
It was a lot more fun when it was at the end
Manifest seems alright, I do think I tend not to take many common block cards
The way the game shakes out most of the time imo is you rush for good common attacks but can be a little choosier with block
As a result I don't really take this card very often but I can at least see why I would wanna take it so good design
<frail>

embeds.title: Frail
embeds.description:
Keyword / Slay the Spire

While **Frail** :p_frail:, gain 25% less **Block** :p_block: from cards.

messages.content: <decay>

embeds.title: Decay
embeds.description:
Curse / Slay the Spire

**Unplayable**.
At the end of your turn, take 2 damage.

messages.content: <frail curse>

embeds.title: Shame
embeds.description:
Curse / Slay the Spire

**Unplayable**.
At the end of your turn, gain 1 **Frail** :p_frail:.

messages.content: nothing generates shame
Just events can give you it
cheat used to give shame. got changed later
Random curse events and also the normal version of the beggars event iirc
It's kind of a shame
Especially since it synergies with determination
yeah it’s just doubt
horseshoe determination is so fun ngl
If manifest gave shame instead of decay it would be kind of like worse panic button, plenty of block right now but compromised defense on the next turn
Which isn't necessary a bad thing in a lot of fights
considering that <hole up> used to be a pair with desperado (deal damage gain frail), there's probably a reason alex didn't make the cards give their matching debuff

embeds.title: Hole Up
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 12 (16) **Block** :p_block:.
Gain 2 **Weak** :p_weak:.

messages.content: <hermit gain frail>

embeds.title: Horseshoe
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you gain **Weak** :p_weak:, **Frail** :p_frail: or **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:, gain 1 less.
*Lucky charm. Somebody is gonna be missing this.*

messages.content: yeah it just makes doubt free strength
memento free strength also
I mean your deck is still gonna be less consistent
But thats a broader problem with "curses are good" design
only the Cursed manages to avoid that problem
and they are op as hell
Also you still don't always get determination
And frail is pretty bad in a vacuum
seems to be some split opinions
my opinion is that it is good and I like it
hermit likes small decklists except for full strike builds, so the base Covet can negate the Decay more often than not
so a raw 16-20 block and potential curse synergy is great for a common
and even if you can't negate the curse, +2 incoming damage that turn is ignorable

in longer fights it might be an issue, but a single <shadow cloak> will completely ignore the damage downside. If you feel the need to run Shadow Cloak in the first place, i'd beg to differ you have *some* kind of curse negation

embeds.title: Shadow Cloak
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you draw or **Exhaust** a **Curse**, gain 4 (6) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: <replaces old locket>is the best I can think of if you prefer a hands-off approach

embeds.title: Clasped Locket
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

Replaces Old Locket. First time you draw a curse each turn, **Exhaust** it and draw 2 cards. Upon pickup, obtain 2 Injuries.
*It won't open anymore.*

messages.content: but even reusing the Covet is fantastic

Reminiscent of turbo and overclock. You get a big effect now, but will have to pay for it later when the bad card gets reshuffled into your draw pile. Unlike defect, hermit has quite a few ways to mitigate the curse this card adds, including your starting covet. You could also try to use the newly added curse for a benefit with shadow cloak or spite. I like the overall design, it's a cool idea, with a relevant downside, that can be turned to your advantage with some work put in.

It does however have some stiff competition as a block card. Dive and ghostly presence both block for pretty solid amounts and have upsides, hole up blocks much more efficiently than manifest at 1 energy, only temporarily debuffs you, the drawback won't matter at all until next turn, and may be irrelevant if you have enough damage scaling (determination), or just don't need to deal damage that turn (most boss fights, any turn that is more about scaling/blocking). 

As a pure block card that adds a curse to your deck, it's also difficult to take early in the run. You really need to be focusing on damage early on to handle the elites, and curses hurt a lot more early on when you have a small deck and will reshuffle it faster. It becomes more useful as you enter act 2, but that gives you a lot of time to find other options for front-loaded block. If you have any sort of dexterity scaling (smooth stone, maintenance, kunai), you would rather use cheaper block cards, and some of them also have the benefit of working really well with smoking barrel (dive, vantage, ghostly presence). The upgrade is pretty good, on par with a 2 cost block card. It can become a better block option than the 1 cost cards if you have snecko eye. It can also be the correct choice if you have strong curse synergies, or you are lacking card draw and need to condense your block into 1 card.
Also remember it's a common, so skipping it early is not egreigious
taking it after you've beaten the elites on your path in act 1 is the best scenario i can think of to pick this card
